info.name: ngrok API
info.description:
The official Postman Collection for the ngrok API.

## 🪐 **Get Started**

Steps to get started with the ngrok API:

1. **Fork this Collection.** To use the ngrok API the first step should be to fork this collection to your personal workspace.
    
2. **Configure Authentication.** Configure an environment with your API Key with a variable named `apiKey` to send requests to the API endpoints. You can create an API Key through the ngrok dashboard [API Keys](https://dashboard.ngrok.com/api-keys) page.
    

## 📢 Recent Updates

- **Friday, August 22nd 2024** - Initial Release
    

## 🔐 Authorization

- The ngrok API uses HTTP {{vault:bearer-token}} with API Keys for authorization. You must include an API key in each request to the Postman API as a bearer token through the `authorization` request header.
    
- The API key has been defined as a [collection variable](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/) named `apiKey`. The authorization has been set up at the collection level, so all requests in this collection will automatically inherit the needed header.
    
- You can create an API Key through the ngrok dashboard [API Keys](https://dashboard.ngrok.com/api-keys) page.
    

> ⚠ Don’t leak your secrets! Initial values are saved, and can be shared with others in team workspaces. Current values are local values that are not saved, and won't be persisted in the original shared collection, environment, or globals. [Learn more about variables in Postman](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/#initial-and-current-values) 
  

## Rate and usage limits

The ngrok API enforces a limit on all accounts of `120` requests over a rolling `60` second window. If you exceed the rate limit, ngrok will return `ERR_NGROK_226` and an HTTP Status Code of `429`.

### 🤔 **Need Help?**

If you have any questions or suggestions, please don't hesitate to reach out to us on our [public community repo](https://github.com/ngrok/ngrok) or through support at [support@ngrok.com](https://mailto:support@ngrok.com).

item.name: Abuse Reports

request.description:
Creates a new abuse report which will be reviewed by our system and abuse response team. This API is only available to authorized accounts.

Contact [abuse@ngrok.com](https://mailto:abuse@ngrok.com) to request access.

Create and view ngrok abuse reports which will be reviewed by our system and abuse response team.

### Only available for select accounts.

This API is only available to authorized accounts. Contact [abuse@ngrok.com](https://mailto:abuse@ngrok.com) to request access.
